Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice or Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior glazed streaky dark brown; part of a lotus flower in added white outline with centre in added red above two white bands; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic details and the absence of decoration on the exterior surface make it impossible to determine whether it comes from a kantharos or a chalice. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior; given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) also have very little decoration.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1377) (phase 2)
